nodes.bodyText: should this be completed?
@zohrehj this is a sub-screen, not the main section level 'mark as complete'. I think it should be ok.

I don't think users will know what content-complete means. I prefer we just go with:
"Form step marked complete"

Make this:
The study has been published as an upcoming study.
Make this "The study has been resumed."

Make this:
"The study has been removed from the list of upcoming studies."
"Study updates have been published."
An error occurred and the copy operation could not be completed.
content-complete -> complete
content-complete -> complete
"The Checklist section does not have all items marked complete. Do you want to proceed?"
You must set "Allow participants to enroll?" to "Yes" in the Settings section to launch your study.
One or more items in this section need to be marked as complete to proceed with this action.
expired -> occurred
One or more active tasks that you have selected are not supported by the mobile platform that is configured in the Settings section.
One or more questionnaires have questions with response types that are not supported by the mobile platform that is configured in the Settings section.
You must set "Allow participants to enroll?" to "No" in the Settings section to publish your study as an upcoming study.
You must set "Allow participants to enroll?" to "Yes" in the Settings section to publish updates to your study.
"The Checklist section does not have all items marked complete. Do you want to proceed?"
content-complete -> complete
expired -> occurred
typo here - also "content-complete" -> "complete"
One or more study resources has a visibility period with a start date that has already occurred. Please adjust the date and try again.
"The Checklist section does not have all items marked complete. Do you want to proceed?"
The Basic Information, Settings, Overview and Consent sections must be marked complete before publishing a study as upcoming. Please complete these sections and try again.
All Study Builder sections must be marked complete to publish the study. Please complete these sections to proceed.
All Study Builder sections must be marked complete to publish updates to the study. Please complete these sections to proceed.
Resuming the study will allow mobile application users to resume participation. Would you like to proceed?
Publishing the study as "upcoming" will allow mobile application users to see the study overview and consent form, but will not enable enrollment. Would you like to proceed?
content-complete -> complete
Is the timezone hardcoded here? This is configurable in the application.properties file I believe.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -360,7 +362,8 @@
 
   public static final String SERVER_TIME_ZONE = "America/New_York";

nodes.bodyText: No, we are not using this  anywhere now and it can actually be removed from the file. We'll fix this file and raise a new PR for it later.

@@ -360,7 +362,8 @@
 
   public static final String SERVER_TIME_ZONE = "America/New_York";

nodes.bodyText: The study has been launched and is now available to participants in the mobile applications.
Launching the study will allow mobile application users to see the study and start participating. Would you like to proceed?
Publishing study updates will allow mobile application users to see the changes to the study. Would you like to proceed?

set "Allow participants to enroll?" to "Yes"
